children.text:
Implementing the next permutation algorithm in Fortran. Function to generate next permutation:

subroutine next_permutation(s, changed)
   character(len=*), intent(inout) :: s
   logical, intent(out) :: changed
   integer :: i, j, k, l
   integer :: n
   n = len_trim(s)
   ! Step 1: Find the largest index k such that s(k) < s(k+1)
   k = n-1
   do while (k >= 1 .and. s(k:k) >= s(k+1:k+1))
      k = k -1
   end do
   if (k == 0) then
      changed = .false. return
   end if
   ! Step 2: Find the largest l >k such that s(l) > s(k)
   l = n
   do while (s(l:l) <= s(k:k))
      l = l -1
   end do
   ! Step 3: swap s(k) and s(l)
   temp = s(k:k)
   s(k:k) = s(l:l) s(l:l) = temp
   ! Step 4: reverse from k+1 to end
   do i = 1, (n -k)/2
      j = k + i
      l = n - i +1
      temp = s(j:j)
      s(j:j) = s(l:l) s(l:l) = temp
   end do
   changed = .true.
end subroutine

   subroutine next_permutation(s, changed)

      character(len=*), intent(inout) :: s

      logical, intent(out) :: changed

      integer :: n, k, l, i, j

      n = len_trim(s)

      k = n-1

      do while (k >=1 .and. s(k:k) >= s(k+1:k+1))

         k = k-1

      end do

Function to generate next permutation:

subroutine next_permutation(s, changed)
   character(len=*), intent(inout) :: s
   logical, intent(out) :: changed
   integer :: i, j, k, l
   integer :: n
   n = len_trim(s)
   ! Step 1: Find the largest index k such that s(k) < s(k+1)
   k = n-1
   do while (k >= 1 .and. s(k:k) >= s(k+1:k+1))
      k = k -1
   end do
   if (k == 0) then
      changed = .false.
      return
   end if
   ! Step 2: Find the largest l >k such that s(l) > s(k)
   l = n
   do while (s(l:l) <= s(k:k))
      l = l -1
   end do
   ! Step 3: swap s(k) and s(l)
   temp = s(k:k)
   s(k:k) = s(l:l)
   s(l:l) = temp
   ! Step 4: reverse from k+1 to end
   do i = 1, (n -k)/2

   subroutine generate_permutations(n, perms)

      integer, intent(in) :: n

      character(len=n), dimension(:), allocatable, intent(out) :: perms

      integer :: i, k, l, temp

      character(len=n) :: current_perm

      integer :: count =0

      ! Initialize current_perm as '123...n'

      current_perm = ''

      do i=1,n

         write(current_perm(i:i), '(i1)') i

      end do

      ! Allocate perms array

      allocate(perms(1))

      perms(1) = current_perm

      count =1

      do

         logical :: changed

         call next_permutation(current_perm, changed)

         if (.not. changed) exit

         count = count +1

         perms = [perms, current_perm]

      end do

   end subroutine

   subroutine next_permutation(s, changed)

      character(len=*), intent(inout) :: s

      logical, intent(out) :: changed

      integer :: n, k, l, i, j

      n = len_trim(s)

      k = n-1

      do while (k >=1 .and. s(k:k) >= s(k+1:k+1))

         k = k-1

      end do

      if (k ==0) then

         changed = .false.

         return

      end if

      l = n

      do while (s(l:l) <= s(k:k))

         l = l-1

      end do

      ! swap s(k) and s(l)

      character(len=1) :: temp_char

      temp_char = s(k:k)

      s(k:k) = s(l:l)

      s(l:l) = temp_char

      ! reverse from k+1 to end

      do i=1, (n -k)/2

         j = k +i

         l = n -i +1

         temp_char = s(j:j)

         s(j:j) = s(l:l)

         s(l:l) = temp_char

      end do

      changed = .true.

   end subroutine

end program
